title: Zodiac Trivia
description: How well do you know the zodiac signs and their traits?

questions.question: Which zodiac sign is represented by a lion?
questions.explanation: Leo is represented by the lion. Leo is the fifth sign of the zodiac and covers birthdays from July 23 to August 22.

questions.question: Which zodiac sign is represented by a pair of fish?
questions.explanation: Pisces is represented by two fish swimming in opposite directions. It is the twelfth and final sign of the zodiac (February 19 - March 20).

questions.question: What is the first sign of the zodiac?
questions.explanation: Aries is the first sign of the zodiac, covering birthdays from March 21 to April 19. It is represented by the ram.

questions.question: Which zodiac sign is symbolized by a bull?
questions.explanation: Taurus is symbolized by the bull. It is the second sign of the zodiac, covering April 20 to May 20.

questions.question: Which zodiac sign is represented by twins?
questions.explanation: Gemini is represented by the twins Castor and Pollux from Greek mythology. It covers birthdays from May 21 to June 20.

questions.question: Which element is associated with the signs Aries, Leo, and Sagittarius?
questions.explanation: Aries, Leo, and Sagittarius are the three fire signs. Fire signs are typically associated with energy, passion, and enthusiasm.

questions.question: Which zodiac sign is represented by a water bearer?
questions.explanation: Aquarius is represented by the water bearer. Despite this water imagery, Aquarius is actually an air sign (January 20 - February 18).

questions.question: Which zodiac sign is associated with the scales of justice?
questions.explanation: Libra is represented by the scales, symbolizing balance and justice. It covers September 23 to October 22.

questions.question: What animal represents Sagittarius?
questions.explanation: Sagittarius is represented by the centaur archer — a mythological creature that is half human, half horse, wielding a bow. It covers November 22 to December 21.

questions.question: Which zodiac sign is the only one represented by an inanimate object?
questions.explanation: Libra (the scales) is the only zodiac sign represented by an inanimate object. All other signs are represented by animals or human figures.

questions.question: Which planet traditionally rules the sign of Scorpio?
questions.explanation: Mars is the traditional ruler of Scorpio. In modern astrology, Pluto is also considered a co-ruler, but Mars was the original ruling planet before Pluto's discovery.

questions.question: Which zodiac sign is symbolized by a sea-goat — a creature with the body of a goat and the tail of a fish?
questions.explanation: Capricorn is symbolized by the sea-goat, a mythological creature. This symbol represents the ability to navigate both the material and emotional worlds.

questions.question: Which three signs make up the earth element group?
questions.explanation: Taurus, Virgo, and Capricorn are the three earth signs. Earth signs are typically associated with practicality, stability, and material concerns.

questions.question: In astrology, what is the term for the sign that was on the eastern horizon at the time of your birth?
questions.explanation: The rising sign, also called the Ascendant, is the zodiac sign that was rising on the eastern horizon at the exact time and location of your birth.

questions.question: Which zodiac sign is symbolized by a maiden or virgin and is associated with harvest?
questions.explanation: Virgo is symbolized by the maiden and is associated with the harvest season (August 23 - September 22). The constellation is often linked to Demeter, the Greek goddess of the harvest.
